verses.verse: My brothers, <S%G80><s%> be not many <S%G4183><s%> masters, <S%G1320><s%> knowing <S%G1492><s%> that we shall receive <S%G2983><s%> the greater <S%G3187><s%> condemnation. <S%G2917><s%>

For in many <S%G4183><s%> things we offend <S%G4417><s%> all. <S%G537><s%> If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G1536><s%> man offend <S%G4417><s%> not in word, <S%G3056><s%> the same <S%G3778><s%> is a perfect <S%G5046><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> and able <S%G1415><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to bridle <S%G5469><s%> the whole <S%G3650><s%> body. <S%G4983><s%>

Behold, <S%G2400><s%> we put <S%G906><s%> bits <S%G5469><s%> in the horses' <S%G2462><s%> mouths, <S%G4750><s%> that they may obey <S%G3982><s%> us; and we turn <S%G3329><s%> about <S%G3329><s%> their whole <S%G3650><s%> body. <S%G4983><s%>

Behold <S%G2400><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the ships, <S%G4143><s%> which though they be so <S%G5082><s%> great, <S%G5082><s%> and are driven <S%G1643><s%> of fierce <S%G4642><s%> winds, <S%G417><s%> yet are they turned <S%G3329><s%> about <S%G3329><s%> with a very <S%G1646><s%> small <S%G1646><s%> helm, <S%G4079><s%> wherever <S%G3699><s%> <S%G302><s%> the governor <S%G2116><s%> wants. <S%G3730><s%> <S%G1014><s%>

Even <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> the tongue <S%G1100><s%> is a little <S%G3398><s%> member, <S%G3196><s%> and boasts <S%G3166><s%> great <S%G3166><s%> things. Behold, <S%G2400><s%> how <S%G2245><s%> great <S%G2245><s%> a matter <S%G5208><s%> a little <S%G3641><s%> fire <S%G4442><s%> kindles! <S%G381><s%>

And the tongue <S%G1100><s%> is a fire, <S%G4442><s%> a world <S%G2889><s%> of iniquity: <S%G93><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> is the tongue <S%G1100><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> our members, <S%G3196><s%> that it defiles <S%G4695><s%> the whole <S%G3650><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> and sets <S%G5394><s%> on fire <S%G5394><s%> the course <S%G5164><s%> of nature; <S%G1078><s%> and it is set <S%G5394><s%> on fire <S%G5394><s%> of hell. <S%G1067><s%>

For every <S%G3956><s%> kind <S%G5449><s%> of beasts, <S%G2342><s%> and of birds, <S%G4071><s%> and of serpents, <S%G2062><s%> and of things in the sea, <S%G1724><s%> is tamed, <S%G1150><s%> and has been tamed <S%G1150><s%> of mankind <S%G5449><s%>

But the tongue <S%G1100><s%> can <S%G1410><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> man <S%G444><s%> tame; <S%G1150><s%> it is an unruly <S%G183><s%> evil, <S%G2556><s%> full <S%G3324><s%> of deadly <S%G2287><s%> poison. <S%G2447><s%>

Therewith <S%G1722><s%> <S%G846><s%> bless <S%G2127><s%> we God, <S%G2316><s%> even the Father; <S%G3962><s%> and therewith <S%G1722><s%> <S%G846><s%> curse <S%G2672><s%> we men, <S%G444><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> are made <S%G1096><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> the similitude <S%G3669><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

Out of the same <S%G846><s%> mouth <S%G4750><s%> proceeds <S%G1831><s%> blessing <S%G2129><s%> and cursing. <S%G2671><s%> My brothers, <S%G80><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things ought <S%G5534><s%> not so <S%G3779><s%> to be.
Does a fountain <S%G4077><s%> send <S%G1032><s%> forth <S%G1032><s%> at <S%G1537><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> place <S%G3692><s%> sweet <S%G1099><s%> water and bitter? <S%G4089><s%>

Can <S%G1410><s%> the fig <S%G4808><s%> tree, <S%G4808><s%> my brothers, <S%G80><s%> bear <S%G4160><s%> olive <S%G1636><s%> berries? <S%G1636><s%> either <S%G2228><s%> a vine, <S%G288><s%> figs? <S%G4810><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> can no <S%G3762><s%> fountain <S%G4077><s%> both yield <S%G4160><s%> salt <S%G252><s%> water <S%G5204><s%> and fresh. <S%G1099><s%>

Who <S%G5101><s%> is a wise <S%G4680><s%> man and endued <S%G1990><s%> with knowledge <S%G1990><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you? let him show <S%G1166><s%> out of a good <S%G2570><s%> conversation <S%G391><s%> his works <S%G2041><s%> with meekness <S%G4240><s%> of wisdom. <S%G4678><s%>

But if <S%G1487><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> bitter <S%G4089><s%> envying <S%G2205><s%> and strife <S%G2052><s%> in your <S%G5216><s%> hearts, <S%G2588><s%> glory <S%G2620><s%> not, and lie <S%G5574><s%> not against <S%G2596><s%> the truth. <S%G225><s%>
This <S%G3778><s%> wisdom <S%G4678><s%> descends <S%G2718><s%> not from above, <S%G509><s%> but is earthly, <S%G1919><s%> sensual, <S%G5591><s%> devilish. <S%G1141><s%>
For where <S%G3699><s%> envying <S%G2205><s%> and strife <S%G2052><s%> is, there <S%G1563><s%> is confusion <S%G181><s%> and every <S%G3956><s%> evil <S%G5337><s%> work. <S%G4229><s%>

But the wisdom <S%G4678><s%> that is from above <S%G509><s%> is first <S%G4412><s%> pure, <S%G53><s%> then <S%G1899><s%> peaceable, <S%G1516><s%> gentle, <S%G1933><s%> and easy <S%G2138><s%> to be entreated, <S%G2138><s%> full <S%G3324><s%> of mercy <S%G1656><s%> and good <S%G18><s%> fruits, <S%G2590><s%> without <S%G505><s%> partiality, <S%G87><s%> and without <S%G505><s%> hypocrisy. <S%G505><s%>
And the fruit <S%G2590><s%> of righteousness <S%G1343><s%> is sown <S%G4687><s%> in peace <S%G1515><s%> of them that make <S%G4160><s%> peace. <S%G1515><s%>
